availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Beriah Magoffin: Governor's Official Correspondence File, Executive Journal, 1859-1862

body.p:
2
The Governor approved an account of $56 50/100 to I. L. Sage for repairs to gas fixtures certified by the Librarian as correct
Also account to Steamer Dove of $50.93 for transportation of arms, certified as correct by the Qr Mr Genl.
He remitted to N. Kitchen a Judgment of the Lawrence Circuit Court of $60. for "Tipling"
He pardoned Patrick Donnelly convicted of the crime of Manslaughter by the Jefferson Circuit Court and sentenced to ten years confinement in the Penitentiary
He laid before the General Assembly sundry Resolutions from the States of Maine & Minnesota, also a communication from the Auditor of Public Accounts in regard to the Clerk of Marion County Court.
